metadata.title: CVE-2016-7056 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A timing attack flaw was found in OpenSSL 1.0.1u and before that couldallow a malicious user with local access to recover ECDSA P-256 privatekeys.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.5
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu4.5').
